text: Boluk-bashi () was an Ottoman officer rank equivalent to captain (see Military of the Ottoman Empire). The holder was in command of a bölük, a sub-division of a regiment. It was higher than oda-bashi (lieutenant). __NOTOC__ ==Serbian hajduks== It was adopted by the Serbian hajduks and into the Serbian Revolutionary Army as buljubaša () or buljukbaša (). People such as Janko Gagić, Arsenije Loma, Konda Bimbaša, Zeka Buljubaša, Veljko Petrović and Petar Dobrnjac had the rank of buljubaša in the prelude and during the Serbian Revolution. ==Notable people== *Rıza Tevfik Bölükbaşı, Turkish philosopher *Zerrin Bölükbaşı, Turkish sculptor *Iliaș Colceag ( 1710–1743), Moldavian *Abdul Bölükbaşı ( 1821), Tripolitsa *Yahya bey Dukagjini (1498–1582), Albanian ==See also== *Bölükbaşı (surname) *Buljubašić ==References== Category:Military ranks of the Ottoman Empire Category:Turkish words and phrases
title: Boluk-bashi
